hackathon-description-text: Get ready for fun, challenge, and innovation at NIU's first ever hackathon!  More than 350 students are expected to converge on NIU's campus for 24 hours of brainstorming, coding and design - all aimed at solving problems for area hospitals, schools, libraries, museums, municipalities, and public safety agencies.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Division of Research and Innovation Partnerships
Northern Illinois University Chief Information Officer
Northern Illinois University Chief Information Security Officer
College of Engineering and Engineering Technology
College of Engineering and Engineering Technology
College of Engineering and Engineering Technology
Northern Illinois University Department of Public Affairs
Northern Illinois  University, Director of the Center for Governmental Studies

hackathon-eligibility: Any team can participate by submitting a challenge for consideration.  Must be an eligible student with an active student id card upon check-in, registered with Huskie Hack 2015, and in a team of no more than four individuals.
hackathon-requirements:
Hackers are to provide a complete package with a description of the project and the following:
Sector submitting under
Title
Name of Challenge
Purpose
And then sell it!
Should include specific code information, API or open data sources accessed, and any particular challenges encountered during the construction of the project.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: This award allows the team of four to chose from 1 Pebble Watch, 1 Ollie for Android, 1 Sphero, or Parrot Mini Drone.
8 Lilypad Pro Kits and 8 Leap Motions - for the 4 team winners to choose from
Participants will receive a collection of Hack movies, and a "Meh" Hoodie Sweatshirt.  Movies include:
Arduino Uno ultimate Starte Kit with Book

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Bring Toastmasters Out of the Stone Age

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=Northern Illinois University, 1425 W Lincoln Hwy, DeKalb, IL 60115, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How new is this idea? This could be a radical innovation or a meaningful new take on an existing product or service.
Does the app have the ability to make its users’ lives better, for example by helping them save more, make better financial decisions, or reduce debt?
How easy is the app to use? How does the app look?

hackathon-location-address: Northern Illinois University, 1425 W Lincoln Hwy, DeKalb, IL 60115, USA
hackathon-description-header: Huskie Hack 2015 - Hacking for Social Good
